Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class GameBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.model.GameBoard
  • public class GameBoard
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the board of the game, it contains all the squares, the kill shot track and all the methods to calculate the required squares for actions

      • GameBoard

        public GameBoard​(int gameLength,
                 int mapType)
        Create all the squares and the kill shot track
        Parameters:
        gameLength - Number of skulls, which define the length of the match, from 5 to 8
        mapType - Type of the map, from 0 to 3

      • addKillShotTrack

        public void addKillShotTrack​(java.util.List<PlayerColor> newKillShot)
        Add a new list to the kill shot track each time a player is killed
        Parameters:
        newKillShot - The new kill shot track to addTarget, one PlayerColor for the death and a second one for the overkill

      • getSquares

        public java.util.List<Square> getSquares​(Player player,
                                         int dist)
        This method returns all the squares a Player can move into
        Parameters:
        player - The Player from which calculate di squares
        dist - The maximum distance a player can move
        Returns:
        The list of squares which are at maximum at distance dist from the Player

        Parameters:

      • throughWallsDirection

        private java.util.List<Square> throughWallsDirection​(java.util.List<Square> temp,
                                                     int val)
        This method is an helper of the throughWalls(Player, Square) method
        Parameters:
        temp - List of squares that extend from the player's squares to the chosen direction
        val - Integer that represents the direction the weapon is going to shoot to
        Returns:
        List of squares in the direction chosen by the player, starting from the square they stand upon.

      • removeEmptySquares

        public java.util.List<Square> removeEmptySquares​(java.util.List<Square> squareList)

        Parameters:
        squareList - The list of squares from which we need to remove the square without player on it
        Returns:
        The list of squares which have at least one player on it

      • removeNonPlayerSquares

        public java.util.List<Square> removeNonPlayerSquares​(Player player,
                                                     java.util.List<Square> squareList)
        This method returns the given list of squares without the square a given Player is on if it is the only Player on it
        Parameters:
        player - The Player to check the square it is on
        squareList - The list of squares from which we may need to remove the Square the given Player is on
        Returns:
        The list of squares without the Square the given Player is on if it is the only Player on it
